bug.author: UesugiErii
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/SparseCategoricalCrossentropy>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/SparseCategoricalCrossentropy</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
On the third line of the second code box, origin probability is [.9, .05, .05], [.5, .89, .6], [.05, .01, .94], it should be [.9, .05, .05], [.05, .89, .06], [.05, .01, .94].

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/UesugiErii>@UesugiErii</denchmark-link> , The example is removed in the <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/SparseCategoricalCrossentropy?version=nightly>nightly version</denchmark-link> . I think this will solve your issue.
